list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Enhance password validator conflict handling and add tests
Refactored the MaxLengthValidator to better handle conflicts with other password validation rules. Adjusted PasswordValidatorManager to more optimally add and validate new validators. Added a new data stream in PasswordValidatorTestData and a new test in PasswordValidatorTest for validating password rule conflicts with maximum length.

task.summary:
Add PasswordValidator with tests and Maven project configuration
Introduces PasswordValidator interface along with MinLengthValidator and MaxLengthValidator implementing classes. Also adds tests for password validation classes and Maven project configuration (pom.xml) file. Makes sure max length cannot be less than min length and vice versa. The commit extracts inputs like java.version, junit.jupiter.version and others to properties for flexible configuration.

Update password validators to handle digits
Added a new DigitValidator class to check for digit count in passwords. Adjusted ValidationResult to handle lists of errors instead of a single string message. Updated tests to cover these changes.

Add SpecialCharacterValidator with relevant tests
Implemented a SpecialCharacterValidator to check the minimum number of special characters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to provide test data and verify the functionality of special character validation.

Refactor PasswordValidatorTest to use shared manager
Removed individual declarations of the PasswordValidatorManager in each test method of PasswordValidatorTest. Now a shared validatorManager instance is used, which simplifies the code and reduces redundancy.

Add UpperCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Implemented a new UpperCaseValidator class to validate uppercase character count in passwords. Updated PasswordValidatorTest to include uppercase validation tests. This addition ensures passwords contain an adequate number of uppercase letters.

Remove unused constructor in PasswordValidationConflictException
The code removes an unused constructor from the PasswordValidationConflictException class that previously took a message and a Throwable as input parameters. Simplifying the class to only have necessary components.

Add LowerCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Added a new LowerCaseValidator class to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for this new validator. Made minor adjustments to the UpperCaseValidator test methodology for consistency.

Refactor validators and improve error messaging
Updated validators for clarity and improved their error messages. Minor naming changes have also been made to improve readability and understanding of the code. PasswordValidatorTest has been updated as a part of these changes.

Extract password validator test data into a separate class
Created a new class, PasswordValidatorTestData, to house all the password validation test data that was originally in PasswordValidatorTest. This refactoring aims to improve code readability and maintainability. Removed redundant code in PasswordValidatorTest after the extraction.

Reduce complexity of test data in PasswordValidatorTestData and PasswordValidatorTest
The commit simplifies both the structure of the test data and the test cases themselves in PasswordValidatorTestData and PasswordValidatorTest. It replaces complex object creation with primitive arguments in the test data, enhancing readability. Furthermore, test cases in PasswordValidatorTest have been streamlined by directly using boolean results in assertions.
Delete Password record from validator package as it's no longer in use.

Add new test case and improve readability of existing code
Added a new test case to PasswordValidatorTest for complex password validation. Made minor changes to the existing test data in PasswordValidatorTestData for better readability. The readability was also improved on in PasswordValidatorTest by reformatting multi-parameter function calls.

Add custom exception handling to password validators
Converted PasswordValidator from an interface to an abstract class, updating all existing specifics validators to extend from this abstract class instead of implementing the previous interface. This changes included adding a non-negative value check within the abstract class. Furthermore, a new test case to confirm detection and exception handling of negative values has been added.

Enhance password validator conflict handling and add tests
Refactored the MaxLengthValidator to better handle conflicts with other password validation rules. Adjusted PasswordValidatorManager to more optimally add and validate new validators. Added a new data stream in PasswordValidatorTestData and a new test in PasswordValidatorTest for validating password rule conflicts with maximum length.

MESSAGE.value:
Add LowerCaseValidator and modify UpperCaseValidator
Introduced a new class, LowerCaseValidator, to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Additionally, made modifications in the UpperCaseValidator and updated PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for lowercase validation.

Add LowerCaseValidator, update tests and refactor
Implemented a new class, LowerCaseValidator, to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Revised the PasswordValidatorTest to include corresponding tests for lowercase validation. Some minor alterations were also made in the UpperCaseValidator class.

Add LowerCaseValidator and corresponding tests
Added a new LowerCaseValidator class to validate the minimum number of lowercase letters in passwords. Updated the PasswordValidatorTest to include tests for this new validator. Made minor adjustments to the UpperCaseValidator test methodology for consistency.

Refactor validators and improve error messaging
Updated validators for clarity and improved their error messages. Minor naming changes have also been made to improve readability and understanding of the code. PasswordValidatorTest has been updated as a part of these changes.

Extract password validator test data into a separate class
Created a new class, PasswordValidatorTestData, to house all the password validation test data that was originally in PasswordValidatorTest. This refactoring aims to improve code readability and maintainability. Removed redundant code in PasswordValidatorTest after the extraction.

Simplify validation test data and arguments in PasswordValidatorTestData
The refinement entails the streamlining of validation test data for the PasswordValidator by replacing complex object construction with direct primitive arguments for clarity. PasswordValidatorTest has been pared down to use boolean results directly in assertions, as opposed to complex ValidationResult objects.

Reduce complexity of test data in PasswordValidatorTestData and PasswordValidatorTest
The commit simplifies both the structure of the test data and the test cases themselves in PasswordValidatorTestData and PasswordValidatorTest. It replaces complex object creation with primitive arguments in the test data, enhancing readability. Furthermore, test cases in PasswordValidatorTest have been streamlined by directly using boolean results in assertions.

Remove Password record from validator package
The Password record from the validator package has been deleted. This change reflects efforts to simplify the code structure and reduce complexity. Specifically, it enhances the readability and understandability of the code.

Delete Password.java from validator package
Password.java file has been removed to simplify the validator package. This is in line with efforts to enhance the codebase readability and maintainability.

Remove Password record from validator package
The Password record that previously existed in the validator package has been deleted. This change was implemented in order to simplify the validator package and improve the overall readability and maintainability of the codebase.

Remove Password.java file
The Password.java file was removed, thus eliminating the Password record from the validator package. This is a measure taken to make the codebase more straightforward to comprehend and manage, improving code clarity.
Delete Password record from validator package as it's no longer in use.

The Password record was removed from the validator package to simplify the codebase and enhance readability. The removal of this record impacts the PasswordValidatorTest and the PasswordValidatorTestData, and they have been adjusted appropriately to reflect this change.

Update PasswordValidator tests and data after record removal
The "Password" record within the validator package was removed to simplify the codebase and improve readability. The corresponding test and data classes, "PasswordValidatorTest" and "PasswordValidatorTestData", have been revised accordingly to accommodate this change. In addition, raw inputs were added to test data for clarity and the formatting of multi-parameter function calls was improved for better readability.

Update PasswordValidator tests and data for clarity
The commit removes the "Password" record from the validator package to simplify the codebase, and updates "PasswordValidatorTest" and "PasswordValidatorTestData" to reflect this change. It also enhances readability by replacing complex object constructions with raw inputs in test data and improving the formatting of multi-parameter function calls in tests.

Add new test case and improve readability of existing code
Added a new test case to PasswordValidatorTest for complex password validation. Made minor changes to the existing test data in PasswordValidatorTestData for better readability. The readability was also improved on in PasswordValidatorTest by reformatting multi-parameter function calls.

Refactor password validators, improve error handling
Converted PasswordValidator from an interface to abstract class containing non-negative value verification. Updated various validators to extend PasswordValidator. Introduced new exceptions for specific password validation errors and added a new test case to handle negative values.

Refactor password validators and enhance error handling
Converted PasswordValidator from an interface to an abstract class that includes non-negative value verification. Updated the password validators to extend PasswordValidator, enhanced the password validation exceptions handling, and added a new test case to handle negative values.

Refactor password validators and enhance error handling
PasswordValidator has been transformed from an interface to an abstract class, including non-negative value enforcement. This also involved restructuring existing password validators to inherit from this newly-created abstract class. Additionally, error handling within password validation has been improved, particularly with the introduction of new password validation exceptions. A new test case has been added to assert that negative values are rejected as expected.

Add custom exception handling to password validators
Converted PasswordValidator from an interface to an abstract class, updating all existing specifics validators to extend from this abstract class instead of implementing the previous interface. This changes included adding a non-negative value check within the abstract class. Furthermore, a new test case to confirm detection and exception handling of negative values has been added.

Improve password maximum length validation and tests
Max length password validation handling has been improved by checking against other rule requirements. Custom exception handling was incorporated within the password validators by transforming the PasswordValidator from an interface to an abstract class including non-negative value enforcement. Also, existing specific validators were updated to inherit from this abstract class. A new test case has been added to handle conflicts in password maximum length.

Refactor max length password validation and tests
Improved the password maximum length validation by checking it against other validation rules, and introduced exception handling for negative values by converting the PasswordValidator from an interface to an abstract class that enforces non-negative values. Updated the existing password validators to extend the newly created abstract class. In addition, a new test case was added to handle password maximum length conflicts.

Improve password validation and testing
Enhanced password maximum length validation by comparing it with other validation values. Transformed PasswordValidator into an abstract class that enforces non-negative values, with each specific validator updated to extend this new class. Integrated an extra test case to tackle cases of password maximum length conflicts.

Enhance password max length validation and add conflict testing
Refined the password max length validation logic by including a comparison with other character type count requirements. Converted PasswordValidator into an abstract class to enforce non-negative values, requiring all specific validators to extend from this class. Added a new test case for handling situations when the password maximum length is in conflict with the sum of all character type counts.

Enhance password validator conflict handling and add tests
Refactored the MaxLengthValidator to better handle conflicts with other password validation rules. Adjusted PasswordValidatorManager to more optimally add and validate new validators. Added a new data stream in PasswordValidatorTestData and a new test in PasswordValidatorTest for validating password rule conflicts with maximum length.

Added a new data stream in PasswordValidatorTestData and a new test in PasswordValidatorTest for validating password rule conflicts with maximum length.
